hovertext: Even if you're not using LiteFS yet, the following bit of SQLite advice makes this article absolutely worth the 11 minutes it allegedly takes to read:> Use WAL mode(For bonus points, also bump cache_size up to 20000 or so and set synchronous=NORMAL)
author: PreInternet01

hovertext: The SYNCHRONOUS pragma is great but I'll mention that there is a durability trade-off. In "NORMAL" mode, there is not an fsync() after every transaction so you could lose recent transactions if you unexpectedly shutdown. The WAL is append-only so you don't risk data corruption (which is great).
